summary: The concept of "office technology," redirected to "office automation," encompasses a range of equipment and systems designed to enhance efficiency in workplace environments. In EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this concept is scrutinized for its impact on sustainability and compliance with ecolabel and ecodesign standards. Legislative measures clarify the requirements for office automation equipment, specifying certification processes and labelling to ensure environmental compliance. Parliaments engage in negotiations to update regulations, supporting the implementation of alternative technologies that promote energy efficiency. The enforcement of these regulations involves regular scrutiny of transactions and purchasing practices, ensuring that expired or non-compliant equipment is replaced. This comprehensive approach aims to keep office technology aligned with EU sustainability goals while providing guidance for staff training and operational efficiency.
